qas.question: Why do communications professionals typically specialize in only one or two areas of communication?

answers.text: it is difficult to develop such a broad range of skills

qas.question: What is one of the most important qualifications for a communications professional to have?
What kind of companies may engage in only a few types of communications?
Good people skills is a qualification that is important to what profession?
It is not necessary to have critical and strategical thinking abilities to do what job?
All companies or organizations employ a full spectrum of what?
One of the least important qualifications to be a communications professional is what?
Who is always able to master a broad range of skills?

plausible_answers.text: the capacity to think critically and strategically

qas.question: Besides excellent writing abilities and good 'people' skills, all company employees should  have what other skill?

context: <a2_0>Companies with limited resources<a2_0/> may choose to engage in only a few of these activities, while larger organizations may employ a full spectrum of <b5_0>communications<b5_0/>. Since <a0_0>it is difficult to develop such a broad range of skills<a0_0/>, <b7_0>communications professionals<b7_0/> often specialize in one or two of these areas but usually have at least a working knowledge of most of them. By far, the most important qualifications <a3_0><b4_0>communications<a3_0/> professionals<b4_0/> can possess are <a1_0><b6_0>excellent writing ability<b6_0/><a1_0/>, good 'people' skills, and <b8_0>the capacity to think critically and strategically<b8_0/>.
